Issues.Title: Dynamic form guide does not use new typed forms
Issues.Body:
### Description

In a couple of my projects I used the dynamic form guide as a base for setting up a form builder (which has become vastly more complicated nowadays than the original guide) which I use everywhere to handle all forms (all the projects it is used in are form-heavy, so stumbling across the guide a number of years ago was a blessing in disguise!).

With the release of typed forms in angular 14, I returned to the guide in order to get some pre-emptive information on what it'd look like to convert my builder to use the new system. However, it looks like the guide has not yet been updated to use either of the new classes (TypedFormControls or UntypedFormControls).

### What is the affected URL?

https://angular.io/guide/dynamic-form

Issues.Title: programmatically evaluate template interpolations and template expressions with scope
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

Some Projects need user input to be processed as js/ts code.
Due to security issues eval() should be avoided.
In AngularJS expressions could be evaluated with a scope.
To do the same in Angular you could leverage https://github.com/peerigon/angular-expressions.
However since there already is a template and expression parser integrated Angular, there is probably no need to add new dependencies. 
It would be nice to provide examples how use those to evaluate strings containing templates or expressions in ts  within a scope - or if that is not possible right now, to refactor the existing template and expression parser so that they can be used in the above described manner.


### Use Case

https://github.com/peerigon/angular-expressions

Issues.Title: feat: Add Async Stack Tagging API support
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [x] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


Chrome has an experimental API to improve the debug experience of the
async tasks.
The details can be found here https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=332624#c29

This commit add the `async stack tagging` support in the `zone.js`.
User can `import 'zone.js/plugins/async-stack-tagging';` to enable this
feature.

Here is a sample when enable this feature 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1442575/177109625-9c3700f7-e32e-4dac-8c74-af9363ee2957.png)

So we can use `console.trace` to print the async tasks chain information.

Issues.Title: Views attached to ApplicationRef cannot be detached from Change Detection unless they're dettached from ApplicationRef itself
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

If you create a view and add it to `ApplicationRef` directly, then calling `changeDetectorRef.detach()` will have no effect. It's expected that when detaching the view from change detection, CD does not run, even if it's directly attached to ApplicationRef.

I believe this is related to the fact that `ApplicationRef` does a manual `detectChanges()` call without checking the LView's DIRTY/ATTACHED flags.

https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/3a60063a54d850c50ce962a8a39ce01cfee71398/packages/core/src/application_ref.ts#L986-L988

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-vvznhk?devToolsHeight=33&file=src/app/app.component.ts

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular 14, but is present in all versions, I believe. See the stackblitz example for details
```

Issues.Title: feat(compiler-cli): add extended diagnostic for non-nullable optional‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶ chains

This commit adds an extended diagnostics check that is similar to the nullish
coalescing check, but targeting optional chains. If the receiver expression
of the optional chain is non-nullable, then the extended diagnostic can report
an error or warning that can be fixed by changing the optional chain into a
regular access.

Closes #44870

Issues.Title: Add possibility to use FormArray controls with OnPush components
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

forms

### Description

Right now, it is not possible to use `controls` property with `OnPush` change detection components when we add or remove control in `FormArray` because it modifies the existing array of controls.

### Proposed solution

Add an observable to `FormArray` class that will notify whenever we add or remove control.

### Alternatives considered

Instead of modifying existing controls, create new controls array whenever we add or remove control.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add possibility to use FormArray controls with OnPush components" (#46681)

Issues.Title: refactor(router): Remove custom error message for invalid guards
Issues.Body:
This custom error message for invalid guards requires a fair bit of
extra logic in several places. This change reduces special logic for an error
case that would fail anyways. Additionally, there were already a couple
places that _did not_ have this special error and we have not seen any
indication that there is more confusion for those (resolvers and canMatch).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(router): Remove custom error message for invalid guards" (#46680)

Issues.Body:

just dev-infra is being updated. In order to make our lint job happy

at least 20 characters long.

Issues.Title: feat(router): Add stable cancellation code to `NavigationCancel` event
Issues.Body:
This commit adds a stable cancelation code to the `NavigationCancel`
event. This code is acceptable for use in production whereas parsing the
`reason` string is not. This allows developers to determine more
specifically _why_ a navigation was canceled and perform different
actions in different scenarios.

[related internal issue](http://b/235349774)

Issues.Title: Accessibility Extended Diagnostics: Ensure that aria-* attributes are valid on the element based on its aria role
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

Extended Diagnostics

### Description

WCAG maps the valid ARIA attributes based on a given aria role. We can ensure that aria-* attributes are valid on the element based on it‚Äôs role. Googlers see: [a map of valid aria](http://go/a11y-analyzer-rules#allowed-attributes-by-role).

### Proposed solution

A new Accessibility Extended Diagnostic can provide developers guidance on valid aria-* attributes.

Base case: DOM primitives and native HTML elements with known aria-role
Inferred case: @Component() and @NgModule() with declarative API‚Äôs which can infer the aria-role
Stretch: Nested @Component() and @NgModule() or <ng-content> with an unknown aria-role

### Alternatives considered

This is an extension from the ideas in https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/44869 for A11y validation.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Accessibility Extended Diagnostics: Ensure that aria-* attributes are valid on the element based on its aria role" (#46673)

<details>
<summary>evanw/esbuild</summary>

### [`v0.14.48`](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#​01448)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/compare/v0.14.47...v0.14.48)

-   Enable using esbuild in Deno via WebAssembly ([#​2323](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/2323))

    The native implementation of esbuild is much faster than the WebAssembly version, but some people don't want to give Deno the `--allow-run` permission necessary to run esbuild and are ok waiting longer for their builds to finish when using the WebAssembly backend. With this release, you can now use esbuild via WebAssembly in Deno. To do this you will need to import from `wasm.js` instead of `mod.js`:

    ```js
    import * as esbuild from 'https://deno.land/x/esbuild@v0.14.48/wasm.js'
    const ts = 'let test: boolean = true'
    const result = await esbuild.transform(ts, { loader: 'ts' })
    console.log('result:', result)
    ```

    Make sure you run Deno with `--allow-net` so esbuild can download the WebAssembly module. Using esbuild like this starts up a worker thread that runs esbuild in parallel (unless you call `esbuild.initialize({ worker: false })` to tell esbuild to run on the main thread). If you want to, you can call `esbuild.stop()` to terminate the worker if you won't be using esbuild anymore and you want to reclaim the memory.

    Note that Deno appears to have a bug where background WebAssembly optimization can prevent the process from exiting for many seconds. If you are trying to use Deno and WebAssembly to run esbuild quickly, you may need to manually call `Deno.exit(0)` after your code has finished running.

-   Add support for font file MIME types ([#​2337](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/2337))

    This release adds support for font file MIME types to esbuild, which means they are now recognized by the built-in local web server and they are now used when a font file is loaded using the `dataurl` loader. The full set of newly-added file extension MIME type mappings is as follows:

    -   `.eot` => `application/vnd.ms-fontobject`
    -   `.otf` => `font/otf`
    -   `.sfnt` => `font/sfnt`
    -   `.ttf` => `font/ttf`
    -   `.woff` => `font/woff`
    -   `.woff2` => `font/woff2`

-   Remove `"use strict";` when targeting ESM ([#​2347](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/2347))

    All ES module code is automatically in strict mode, so a `"use strict";` directive is unnecessary. With this release, esbuild will now remove the `"use strict";` directive if the output format is ESM. This change makes the generated output file a few bytes smaller:

    ```js
    // Original code
    'use strict'
    export let foo = 123

    // Old output (with --format=esm --minify)
    "use strict";let t=123;export{t as foo};

    // New output (with --format=esm --minify)
    let t=123;export{t as foo};
    ```

-   Attempt to have esbuild work with Deno on FreeBSD ([#​2356](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/2356))

    Deno doesn't support FreeBSD, but it's possible to build Deno for FreeBSD with some additional patches on top. This release of esbuild changes esbuild's Deno installer to download esbuild's FreeBSD binary in this situation. This configuration is unsupported although in theory everything should work.

-   Add some more target JavaScript engines ([#​2357](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/2357))

    This release adds the [Rhino](https://togithub.com/mozilla/rhino) and [Hermes](https://hermesengine.dev/) JavaScript engines to the set of engine identifiers that can be passed to the `--target` flag. You can use this to restrict esbuild to only using JavaScript features that are supported on those engines in the output files that esbuild generates.

</details>

### [`v7.0.0`](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/releases/tag/v7.0.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/compare/v6.0.1...v7.0.0)

Welcome to parse5@​7.0.0! ‚ú® This is a huge release with many changes, features and fixes.

From an organisational perspective, the most important change is that parse5 is now maintained by a team, consisting of James ([@​43081j](https://togithub.com/43081j)), Titus ([@​wooorm](https://togithub.com/wooorm)) and me ([@​fb55](https://togithub.com/fb55)). We come from three projects that rely on parse5 ‚Äî namely [Cheerio](https://togithub.com/cheeriojs/cheerio), [rehype](https://togithub.com/rehypejs/rehype), and [Lit](https://lit.dev/).

**We need your support to continue the project!** If you care about parse5, please support us financially on [OpenCollective](https://opencollective.com/parse5).

Headlining features of this release are ES Modules, TypeScript, and performance improvements: 7.0.0 is 45% faster than 6.0.1 with default options, and 167% faster with location information enabled (for the `bench/perf` benchmark, on an M1 Mac). Version 7.0.0 is a revamp of every part of the library. There are too many changes to list them all here, so here is a high-level overview:

##### Breaking: ESM

All of parse5‚Äôs packages are now ECMAScript Modules. We are providing dual packages for `parse5` and `parse5-htmlparser2-tree-adapter` for now (see [https://github.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/418](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/418) and [https://github.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/496](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/496)).

To migrate, please read [this Gist](https://gist.github.com/sindresorhus/a39789f98801d908bbc7ff3ecc99d99c) on how to update. Note that private internals are no longer available; instead, everything that you need should be imported from the main package.

*Implemented by [@​43081j](https://togithub.com/43081j) in [#​351](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/issues/351)*

##### Breaking: TypeScript

The codebase has been ported to TypeScript. This helped uncover a number of subtle logic bugs, such as [`dc4e269`](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/commit/dc4e269022ebbae0767d8f790a29d6be1835fe1e), [`b4b5d4a`](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/commit/b4b5d4ad6f90b3c9fd03a90e2ed5267929979a11), or [`a0aff95`](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/commit/a0aff9578bb44511bc169c1d7f9e2f2780f7f8a0). TypeScript also helps us refactor with confidence and a lot of the changes in this release would have been much harder to do without it.

To migrate, please remove `@types/parse5*` as we now ship our own types.

*Implemented by [@​fb55](https://togithub.com/fb55) in [#​362](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/issues/362)*

##### Potentially breaking changes

-   parse5 was caught up with the HTML spec, and parsing results might differ in edge-cases ([https://github.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/442](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/442), [https://github.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/451](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/451))
-   The `parse5-serializer-stream` package was removed [https://github.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/481](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/481)
    -   To migrate, use the `serialize` function exported by `parse5`.
-   The rewriting stream now splits very long text sections ([https://github.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/434](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/434)) and doesn‚Äôt escape text in special tags anymore ([#​434](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/issues/434)). If you worked around these issues before, you might have to update your code.
-   The htmlparser2 adapter now uses `domhandler`‚Äôs node interface ([https://github.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/327](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/327) by [@​TrySound](https://togithub.com/TrySound))
    -   The format of the tree nodes has changed slightly; eg. some previous properties are now getters and setters, and vice versa.

If you are using deep imports for any parts of the codebase, you will likely encounter some breakages:

<details><summary>Show internal changes</summary>

-   The tokenizer now uses the state machine pattern from htmlparser2 [`5d7a780` (#​362)](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/362/commits/5d7a780b70d3669def4c6bb20cbec816804d44a5)
-   The token queue was replaced with callbacks ([https://github.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/404](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/404), [https://github.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/405](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/405), [https://github.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/419](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/419))
-   The `OpenElementStack` now uses callbacks [https://github.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/429](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/429)
-   Mixins were removed (as part of [#​362](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/issues/362))
    -   Location tracking now has a substantially lower overhead [https://github.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/402](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/402)
-   `getNextToken` was removed [https://github.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/461](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/461)
-   The parser‚Äôs `_bootstrap` method was removed [https://github.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/384](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/384)
-   We now drop chunks from the tokenizer right after they are emitted [https://github.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/432](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/432)
-   The serializer is no longer a class; instead, different serializer functions call on each other [https://github.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/383](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/383)
-   parse5 now uses the `entities` module for encoding and decoding entities, sharing maintenance & optimisation work with projects such as htmlparser2 ([`2b92054` (#​362)](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/362/commits/2b9205458b9305de1406966568567ccfc1633fa1), [https://github.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/486](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/pull/486))
    -   `entities` adopted a variant of parse5‚Äôs approach of decoding entities. As a result, decoding performance is equivalent, while memory consumption is slightly lower.

</details>
##### Other changes

-   **minor** add hooks for stack events to tree adapter interface [#​385](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/issues/385)
-   **minor** add support for fragments in `parse5-parser-stream` [#​487](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/issues/487)
-   **minor** add `serializeOuter` (like `.outerHTML`), `scriptingEnabled` option [#​383](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/issues/383)
-   **patch** fix parsing of `<<` in comments parsed wrongly as `<!` ([#​326](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/issues/326))
-   **patch** fix position of `endTag` for mixed-case foreign elements ([#​353](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/issues/353))
-   **patch** fix end position of `html`, `body` ([#​436](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/issues/436))
-   docs: parse5 has a new documentation website at [`parse5.js.org`](http://parse5.js.org/) [#​443](https://togithub.com/inikulin/parse5/issues/443)

##### New Contributors

Thanks [@​anko](https://togithub.com/anko), [@​TrySound](https://togithub.com/TrySound), [@​samouri](https://togithub.com/samouri), [@​alan-agius4](https://togithub.com/alan-agius4), and [@​pmdartus](https://togithub.com/pmdartus)!

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/inikulin/parse5/compare/v6.0.1...v7.0.0

</details>

Issues.Title: build: enable renovate dependency dashboard
Issues.Body:
Enable the Renovate dashboard to see what we are missing/what
is going on after switching to the self-hosted runner. Renovate
might avoid some PRs due to previously-closed old PRs with
the official Mend renovate app operating on upstream branches.

Also provide the Renovate schema.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: enable renovate dependency dashboard" (#23491)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular/create): add support for `yarn create` and `npm init`
Issues.Body:
With this change we add support to scaffold  an Angular workspace using `yarn create @angular` and `npm init @angular`. These shortcuts support all of the `ng-new` options.

Closes #10339 and closes #14292
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@angular/create): add support for `yarn create` and `npm init`" (#23492)

Issues.Title: fix(@ngtools/webpack): do not run ngcc when `node_modules` does not exist
Issues.Body:
Prior to this change the CLI would fail with an error when ngcc could not
be run due to a missing `node_modules` directory, as is the case with Yarn
Plug'n'Play for example. The workaround was to create an empty `node_modules`
directory, but this is inconvenient and shouldn't make any difference.

This commit removes the error and simply skips ngcc processing.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@ngtools/webpack): do not run ngcc when `node_modules` does not exist" (#23487)

Issues.Title: [BIG BIG FEATURE]: Support PUG files as alternative to HTML
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

compiler-cli, compiler

### Description

Hello Angular Team,

First of all I wanna say I love you and I'm very glad you make Angular possible!!! I use Angular since 5 last years and I really think this is the best framework ever done !!

I do programming since 2009, and I dicovered today the PUG format file which is a wonderful alternative to HTML. It is so energy less reading those files it surprised me!

I did some research to know if it's compatible with Angular and it is not the case by default.

I think this is one of the best features that Angular can comes with by default for the next version!!! Support everything from PUG format files :) 

### Proposed solution

Read above : Support everything from PUG format files :) 

### Alternatives considered

Do nothing, but don't do that!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[BIG BIG FEATURE]: Support PUG files as alternative to HTML" (#23489)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/cli): improve error message for project-specific ng commands when run outside of a project
Issues.Body:
With this change we improve the error message when a project for a command cannot be determined

```
Error: Cannot determine project for command.
This is a multi-project workspace and more than one project supports this command. Run "ng build [project]" to execute the command for a specific project or change the current working directory to a project directory.

Available projects are:
- project-name-0
- project-name-1
- project-name-2
- project-name-3
- project-name-4
- project-name-5
- project-name-6
- project-name-7
- project-name-8
- project-name-9
```

Closes #23481

--- 

Note: I haven't limited the number of project to display because we already display the full list when using the `--help` option and so far we didn't have complaints. We can re-evaluate and limit if someone opens an issue.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/cli): improve error message for project-specific ng commands when run outside of a project" (#23484)

Issues.Title: Improve error message for project-specific `ng` commands outside a project
Issues.Body:
Spin off from #23470.

Project-specific Angular CLI commands don't currently give a great error message when run in a workspace but outside a project. I forget the exact text but something along the lines of "No project available". We should improve this to clarify what we mean by project and ideally list out available projects in the workspace. Something like:

```
$ ng serve
This is a monorepository workspace and there are many projects you can serve. Run `ng serve <project>` to serve a specific application. Available projects are:
* my-app
* my-lib
* my-other-lib
```

In really big workspaces we might want to limit this list so we don't explode the console. Maybe limit to 5 or 10 projects with a suggestion to look at `angular.json` for more.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Improve error message for project-specific `ng` commands outside a project" (#23481)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): support hidden component stylesheet sourcemaps with esbuild builder
Issues.Body:
The hidden stylesheet option was incorrectly being ignored for component
stylesheets when using the experimental esbuild-based browser application
builder. The hidden option will now correctly not include the stylesheet
comment within the stylesheet text for components.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): support hidden component stylesheet sourcemaps with esbuild builder" (#23483)

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): prevent importing `RouterModule` parallel to `RoutingModule`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@schematics/angular): prevent importing `RouterModule` parallel to `RoutingModule`" (#23486)

Issues.Title: Schematics class name validation
Issues.Body:
**fix(@angular-devkit/core): `classify` string util should concat string without using a `.`**

`.` is not a valid character in ES6 class names.

Prior to this change `foo.module` before used to be incorrectly classified to `Foo.Module` instead of `FooModule`.

Closes #13824


----

**fix(@schematics/angular): prevent numbers from class names**
    
With this change we prevent creating classes with invalid characters.
    
Closes #12868

---

Combined into a single PR as they are dependent on each other.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Schematics class name validation" (#23485)

Issues.Title: List available projects in a workspace - `ng projects`
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

### Command (mark with an `x`)

- [X] projects

### Description

In large Angular monorepo workspaces, it can sometimes be non-obvious to discover all the available projects which can be built. We should consider a new command (`ng projects`, `ng ls`, etc.) which lists all the projects in the current workspace. This can help new developers in workspace figure out exactly what they want to work on and how to do it.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Workaround is to introspect the `angular.json` file, which is not obvious or easy to do, especially for a new developer.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "List available projects in a workspace - `ng projects`" (#23482)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/cli): show deprecated workspace options in IDE
Issues.Body: With this change deprecated options in angular.json will be visible in the IDE.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/cli): show deprecated workspace options in IDE" (#23480)

Issues.Title: build: account for rename of `angular/code-of-conduct` default branch
Issues.Body:
We just renamed the Angular code of conduct repository default branch
to `main`. This repository was not part of the large migration and is
now handled separately as a little clean-up.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: account for rename of `angular/code-of-conduct` default branch" (#23479)

Issues.Title: build: add bazel config that disabled sharding and flaky re-runs
Issues.Body:
This is useful when running tests locally as otherwise 50 workers are spawned when running the `//packages/angular_devkit/build_angular:build_angular_browser_test` target even when having an `fit` on a single test. This also disabled re-runs on flaky tests.

//cc @devversion, not sure if there is a better way.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: add bazel config that disabled sharding and flaky re-runs" (#23478)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): don't override base-href in HTML when it's not set in builder
Issues.Body:
With this change we fix a regression were we  set the base-href to `/` when the browser builder `baseHref` option is not set.

Closes #23475
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): don't override base-href in HTML when it's not set in builder" (#23477)

Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 14.0.3 ### Description Writing the tag `` in the `` section of the file index.html was respected when issuing the command `ng build`. Now it is replaced with `` which makes it impossible to load the .js and .css files needed to run the app, because they are not found if the app is not deployed on the root directory of the server. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Just create a new project with version 14.0.4, then modify the index.html file, `` or ``, and after building the resulting (dist directory) index.html should have `` instead of the correct configured value for the tag. ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): disable glob mounting for patterns that start with a forward slash
Issues.Body:
By default, a glob pattern starting with a forward slash will be "mounted" onto the system root. This causes globs to escape the workspace root.

With this change we configure disable glob "mounting".

Closes #23467

---

Note: we should probably eventually validate the paths in the workspace config.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): disable glob mounting for patterns that start with a forward slash" (#23472)

Issues.Title: bug(Tooltip): is not close when cursor is moving toward the tooltip
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

12

### Description

Up to angular material version 12 included the tooltip was closed when the cursor pointer move to the tooltip.
Since angular material version 13  this behavior was changed as you can see from your [changelog](https://github.com/angular/components/pull/24475)  

This new behavior cause a bug in a big project I'm workin on.
This is a regression since version 13.

I think the best will be if you can give to the tooltip directive a new input which keep the tooltip open in case cursor is move toward the tooltip and the old behavior will continue work as it was.
other wise it brake the old behavior.


### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. open [angular materi](https://material.angular.io/components/tooltip/overview) in the first example move the mouse toward the tooltip the tooltip not disappear. this start from version 13 


u can see it work as expected in version 12 -> https://v12.material.angular.io/components/tooltip/overview


### Expected Behavior

tooltip should be closed when cursor pointer move toward the tooltip

### Actual Behavior

tooltip is keep display when cursor pointer move toward the tooltip

### Environment

- Angular: 13 and 14
- CDK/Material: 13 and 14
- Browser(s): all browser
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): mac
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(Tooltip): is not close when cursor is moving toward the tooltip" (#25219)

Issues.Title: fix(material/tabs): ink bar not shown in some cases
Issues.Body:
In #24000 the ink bar was switched from `requestAnimationFrame` to `NgZone.onStable` in order to avoids timeouts when the browser is in the background. The problem is that if the zone is already stable, it may take some user interaction before it becomes unstable again and emits to `onStable`.

These changes wrap the call in `NgZone.run` to guarantee that it'll be unstable.

Fixes #25117.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/tabs): ink bar not shown in some cases" (#25218)

Issues.Title: error (Angular Material - datepicker): Type MatDatepicker is not assignable to type MatDatepickerPanel<MatDatepickerControl
Issues.Body: ### Is this a regression? - [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version ### The previous version in which this bug was not present was _No response_ ### Description Intellij shows mismatching types for the assignment of a datepicker to the input. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5721655/176910888-2d4bbcc5-c278-4421-b178-fb397724ea1b.png) there was already a bug report for this issue: #24572 this issue was closed with the explanation: `It sounds like an issue with Webstorm which we can't do anything about.` But i think that is not true because this error looks correct to me. If you look into the angular material datepicker components. The `MatDatepickerInput` expects a `MatDatepickerPanel`. But the `` component is of type `MatDatepicker extends MatDatepickerBase, D | null, D>` And if you try to assign a `` to the `MatDatepickerInput` it tries to match type `MatDatepicker` with `MatDatepickerPanel` ### Reproduction HTML: ``` Select Date ``` TS: `today = new Date();` ### Expected Behavior Intellij doesnt show an error class MatDatepickerInput expects a datepicker of Type MatDatepicker ### Actual Behavior Intellij show an error because of missmatching types class MatDatepickerInput expects a datepicker of Type MatDatepickerPanel ### Environment - Angular: 13.2.3 - CDK/Material: 13.2.3 - IDE: Intellij / WebStorm
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "error (Angular Material - datepicker): Type MatDatepicker is not assignable to type MatDatepickerPanel<MatDatepickerControl" (#25208)

Issues.Title: feat(mdc-button): Use Material 3 naming for Angular (button) components
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

Atm the naming of the mdc-button is (mostly) the same as in the current/legacy `mat-button`

However, the buttons in https://m3.material.io/components/buttons/overview have different names:
- [Elevated button](https://m3.material.io/m3/pages/common-buttons/guidelines/#4e89da4d-a8fa-4e20-bb8d-b8a93eff3e3e)
- [Filled button](https://m3.material.io/m3/pages/common-buttons/guidelines/#9ecffdb3-ef29-47e7-8d5d-f78b404fcafe)
- [Filled tonal button](https://m3.material.io/m3/pages/common-buttons/guidelines/#07a1577b-aaf5-4824-a698-03526421058b)
- [Outlined button](https://m3.material.io/m3/pages/common-buttons/guidelines/#3742b09f-c224-43e0-a83e-541bd29d0f05)
- [Text button](https://m3.material.io/m3/pages/common-buttons/guidelines/#c9bcbc0b-ee05-45ad-8e80-e814ae919fbb)

But the current `mdc-button` implementation (still) uses: ` button[mat-button], button[mat-raised-button], button[mat-flat-button],button[mat-stroked-button]`

Wouldn't it be more logical to use the same naming as https://m3.material.io?


### Use Case

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(mdc-button): Use Material 3 naming for Angular (button) components" (#25207)

Issues.Title: bug(datepicker): closing datepicker on monthSelected shows day view briefly
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

At least 8.2.3

### Description

Sometimes you might want to have a datepicker that, at its lowest level, selects a month and then closes. My use-case is that I am on a view with a calendar on a view showing an entire month. Since I am showing a month, picking a day is irrelevant

To get around the datepicker going to a day view when clicking on a month, you can add a function that runs on the `(monthSelected)` event and calls `datepicker.close()` when fired. This works, but it flashes the day view for a split second before closing. It should just close right away.

### Reproduction

Use the example at the very bottom of the official Material docs for the datepicker:
https://material.angular.io/components/datepicker/examples


### Expected Behavior

Use this example that uses Angular Material 8.2.3
https://stackblitz.com/angular/ekjvrbglvnb?file=src%2Fapp%2Fdatepicker-views-selection-example.ts

The datepicker closes immediately upon selecting a month. 

This is just one that I found when researching this issue. It is possible that versions later than this also work.

### Actual Behavior

The datepicker switches to the day view and then closes.

### Environment

- Angular: 14.0.2
- CDK/Material: 14.0.2
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(datepicker): closing datepicker on monthSelected shows day view briefly" (#25191)

Issues.Title: feat(DATAPICKER): Select ranges dates for years and months in only one datapicker.
Issues.Body: ### Feature Description Select ranges dates for years and months too. Example: if I want only select by years or month, I must NECESSARILY use two date pickers, one for start date and another for end date (I can't add two data pickers in my project). Currently, I dont have a choice in angular material to use only one datapicker for the same use (at last, I didn't see this case of use in documentation). My suggestion is there is ranges dates for years and months too, as days. Output: 2020 ~ 2022 = 01/01/2020 to 01/01/2022 may ~ december = 01/05 to 01/12 Now, I'm moving from library datapicker because this issue. This is a problem for other devs can face in future. as is my idea: ### Use Case **WHEN** I click on calendar in only one datapicker in month range mode **I MUST** be able to select many months **WHEN** I click on calendar in only one datapicker year range mode **I MUST** be able to select many years
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(DATAPICKER): Select ranges dates for years and months in only one datapicker." (#25189)

Issues.Title: bug(FocusMonitor): cdk-program-focused on mouse click
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

10.2.7

### Description

When user mouse clicks a checkbox/radio button/slide toggle with a mouse (not keyboard, not programatically), the clicked element contains **cdk-program-focused** class instead of **cdk-mouse-focused** (it always has cdk-focused which is correct). I want to use this cdk-program-focused CSS class to draw special visible focus for accessibility purposes but I don't want this special CSS visible for mouse clicks. **cdk-keyboard-focused** works flawlessly without any issues when user focuses checkbox/radio button/slide toggle with keyboard (even with NVDA on).

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48152706/176430437-5854e4c6-409f-4769-8162-73ba1a6d9c33.png)


I don't know the logic behind this so maybe this was done by design to avoid some accessibility issues with focus monitoring.
Is this by design? It used to work in Material v10.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Navigate to the demos at https://material.angular.io/components/checkbox/overview or https://material.angular.io/components/radio/overview
2. Mouse Click the demo radio button/checkbox so it is checked
3. Open browser DevTools and find the element that you just clicked and look for CSS classes it contains


### Expected Behavior

cdk-mouse-focused should be present in the element, not cdk-program-focused when user clicked the element with a mouse

### Actual Behavior

cdk-program-focused is present in the element instead of cdk-mouse-focused

### Environment

- Angular: 14.0.3
- CDK/Material: 14.0.3
- Browser(s): Chrome/Firefox/Edge
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10 Pro, Version 21H2 (OS Build 19044.1766)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(FocusMonitor): cdk-program-focused on mouse click" (#25188)
